ygData.subject: RE: Don't laugh at this question
ygData.msgSnippet: Galtin, OH I didn t see that you wanted to solo.  I don t think solo is a good idea for a bard, I meant a good group of people around your level or not that
ygData.messageBody:
Galtin,

OH I didn't see that you wanted to solo. I don't think solo is a good idea
for a bard, I meant a good group of people around your level or not that
much higher in the lguk (meant lower guk spider room, dunno why I said
solb...brain fart) spider room with a good puller and the zone not TOO
crowded can rake in some REALLY good xp all the way to level 40.

-Faras

PS-I have never even set foot in solb yet so I have no idea what in the
world I was thinking about yesterday.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Roach
> Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2000 5:55 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Don't laugh at this question
>
>
> solb spider room saved me in hell 35 Galtin.
>
> -Faras
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4
> [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2000 2:29 PM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] Don't laugh at this question
> >
> >
> > From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> >
> > Was wondering if there is a good place for me to solo at 35th
> > level? Spent
> > four hours in Sol A last night in a party and killed a ton of
> > blue goblins.
> > I got maybe 3/4 bar of EXP. The camp was safe but actually
> > pretty boring.
> > I'm willing to take a risk soloing if it will help me get out
> > of 35th. I'm
> > thinking about the only place for me to solo at 35 is Rathe
> > Mtns charming
> > giants against one another. Anyone got a better suggestion.
> > Would it just
> > be better to join a group in one of the dungeons or kill ogre
> > bouncers?
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
